questions.description: Return a greeting message to an alien named 'name'.
questions.answer_code:
def alien_greeting(name):
    return f'Welcome to Earth, {name}!'
questions.hint: Use an f-string to create the greeting message.

questions.description: Calculate the total distance of two hyperspace jumps.
questions.answer_code:
def calculate_hyperspace_distance(distance1, distance2):
    return distance1 + distance2
questions.hint: Add the two distances together.

questions.description: Return the decrypted version of the message by reversing it.
questions.answer_code:
def decrypt_message(message):
    return message[::-1]
questions.hint: Reverse the string using slicing.

questions.description: Calculate the energy equivalent of a mass using E=mc^2. c = 299792458.
questions.hint: Use the formula E = mass * c squared.

questions.description: Return the two planet names joined with ' and ' in between.
questions.answer_code:
def join_planet_names(planet1, planet2):
    return planet1 + ' and ' + planet2
questions.hint: Concatenate the strings with ' and ' in between.

questions.description: Calculate the total oxygen needed for a mission. Multiply hours, astronauts, and oxygen per hour (0.84).
questions.hint: Multiply hours, astronauts, and oxygen per hour.

questions.description: Return the first three letters of the starship name in uppercase.
questions.answer_code:
def get_starship_code(starship_name):
    return starship_name[:3].upper()
questions.hint: Use slicing and the upper() method.

questions.description: Return the coordinates formatted as '(x, y, z)'.
questions.answer_code:
def format_coordinates(x_coord, y_coord, z_coord):
    return f'({x_coord}, {y_coord}, {z_coord})'
questions.hint: Use an f-string to format the coordinates.

questions.description: Convert alien age to Earth years given the planet's year length. Multiply the alien age by the planet's year length in Earth years.
questions.answer_code:
def alien_age_in_earth_years(alien_age, planet_year_length):
    return alien_age * planet_year_length
questions.hint: Multiply the alien age by the planet's year length in Earth years.

questions.description: Return the number of characters in the ship's name.
questions.answer_code:
def ship_name_length(ship_name):
    return len(ship_name)
questions.hint: Use the len() function to get the length.

questions.description: Calculate the time it takes for a signal to travel a certain distance in space. Divide the distance by the speed of light (299792458).
questions.hint: Divide the distance by the speed of light.

questions.description: Return the message with all letters capitalized.
questions.answer_code:
def capitalize_alien_message(message):
    return message.upper()
questions.hint: Use the upper() method.
test_inputs: may the force be with you
so long and thanks for all the fish

questions.description: Split the transmission into a list of words.
questions.answer_code:
def split_transmission(transmission):
    return transmission.split()
questions.hint: Use the split() method.

questions.description: Calculate the fuel efficiency of a starship. Divide the distance by the amount of fuel used.
questions.answer_code:
def calculate_fuel_efficiency(distance, fuel):
    return distance / fuel
questions.hint: Divide the distance by the amount of fuel used.

questions.description: Return the droid's name in uppercase with 'Droid: ' prefixed.
questions.answer_code:
def format_droid_name(droid_name):
    return 'Droid: ' + droid_name.upper()
questions.hint: Use the upper() method and string concatenation.

questions.description: Convert Earth years to years on another planet given its orbital period. Divide Earth years by the planet's orbital period in Earth years.
questions.answer_code:
def calculate_planetary_year(earth_years, orbital_period):
    return earth_years / orbital_period
questions.hint: Divide Earth years by the planet's orbital period in Earth years.

questions.description: Return the last character of the given string.
questions.answer_code:
def get_last_character(text):
    return text[-1]
questions.hint: Use negative indexing to get the last character.

questions.description: Repeat the message a certain number of times.
questions.answer_code:
def repeat_message(message, times):
    return message * times
questions.hint: Use the '*' operator to repeat the string.

questions.description: Calculate the duration of each cryo-sleep cycle for the trip. Divide the total distance by the number of sleep cycles.
questions.answer_code:
def calculate_cryo_sleep_duration(trip_distance, sleep_cycles):
    return trip_distance / sleep_cycles
questions.hint: Divide the total distance by the number of sleep cycles.

questions.description: Return the first element of the given list.
questions.answer_code:
def get_first_element(lst):
    return lst[0]
questions.hint: Use indexing to get the first element.

questions.description: Return the last element of the given list.
questions.answer_code:
def get_last_element(lst):
    return lst[-1]
questions.hint: Use negative indexing to get the last element.

questions.description: Return a sublist from 'start' index to 'end' index (exclusive).
questions.answer_code:
def get_sublist(lst, start, end):
    return lst[start:end]
questions.hint: Use slicing to get a sublist.

questions.description: Remove the first element from the list and return the modified list.
questions.answer_code:
def remove_first_element(lst):
    return lst[1:]
questions.hint: Use slicing to exclude the first element.

questions.description: Remove the last element from the list and return the modified list.
questions.answer_code:
def remove_last_element(lst):
    return lst[:-1]
questions.hint: Use slicing to exclude the last element.

questions.description: Return the concatenation of two lists.
questions.answer_code:
def concatenate_lists(lst1, lst2):
    return lst1 + lst2
questions.hint: Use the '+' operator to concatenate lists.

questions.description: Return the list repeated 'times' number of times.
questions.answer_code:
def repeat_list(lst, times):
    return lst * times
questions.hint: Use the '*' operator to repeat the list.

questions.description: Return the list after removing the first occurrence of 'element'.
questions.answer_code:
def remove_element(lst, element):
    lst_copy = lst.copy()
    lst_copy.remove(element)
    return lst_copy
questions.hint: Use the 'remove()' method to remove the element.

questions.description: Return the element at the given 'index' in the list.
questions.answer_code:
def get_element_at_index(lst, index):
    return lst[index]
questions.hint: Use indexing to get the element at 'index'.

questions.description: Return the reversed list.
questions.answer_code:
def reverse_list(lst):
    return lst[::-1]
questions.hint: Use slicing to reverse the list.

questions.description: Return the number of times 'element' occurs in the list.
questions.answer_code:
def count_element_occurrences(lst, element):
    return lst.count(element)
questions.hint: Use the 'count()' method of lists.
